etymology.description: phonetic 鬳(鬳) + semantic 瓦(瓦)
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the phonetic element 鬳 (yǎn, 'cooking vessel') with the semantic element 瓦 (wǎ, 'earthenware'), which represents something made from clay or pottery, leading to the meaning of a 'cauldron'.

examples.chinese: 在历史书中出现这个字(在歷史書中出現這個字)。
examples.pinyin: Zài lìshǐ shū zhōng chūxiàn zhège zì.
examples.english: This character appears in historical texts.

examples.chinese: 古代有许多种类的鬲(古代有許多種類的鬲)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài yǒu xǔduō zhǒnglèi de gě.
examples.english: There were many kinds of cauldrons in ancient times.
